sufian.video.stream.packetizer

Class RTPSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.DatagramSocket
      • sufian.video.stream.packetizer.RTPSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class RTPSocket
extends DatagramSocket
    A simple implementation of an RTP socket. This is basically a DatagramSocket with a buffer which contains the standard RTP header.
    Author:
    Sufian Latif
    See Also:
    RFC 3550 for RTP specifications and Section 5 for header description .

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Set this to true to get Log messages from this class.

      Standard RTP header length: 12 bytes.

      Maximum length of an RTP packet (including header).
      private byte pType
      Payload type.
      private int seq
      RTP sequence number.
      private int ssrc
      Synchronization source identifier.
      private String TAG 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RTPSocket()
      Creates an RTPSocket over a DatagramSocket on an arbitrary available port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RTPSocket

        public RTPSocket()
          throws SocketException
        Creates an RTPSocket over a DatagramSocket on an arbitrary available port. Initializes the buffer with MAX_SIZE bytes, seq and ssrc with two random integers and pType with 96 (dynamic type).
        Throws:
        SocketException - If an error occurs while creating or binding the socket

    • Method Detail

      • getBuffer

        public byte[] getBuffer()
        Returns:
        The buffer to write the data on

      • setPType

        public void setPType(byte t)
        For setting the payload type externally.
        Parameters:
        t - Value of the payload type

      • markPacket

        public void markPacket()
        Sets the 'mark' bit on.

      • setSeq

        private void setSeq()
        Writes the sequence number to the packet and updates it.

      • setSSRC

        private void setSSRC()
        Writes the SSRC to the packet. This will remain unchanged in the whole session.

      • setTStamp

        public void setTStamp(long ts)
        Writes the timestamp field.
        Parameters:
        ts - A 32-bit value to set

      • send

        public void send(int size)
          throws IOException
        Sends the specified number of bytes of the buffer to the remote port.
        Parameters:
        size - Number of bytes to send
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while sending the packet
